questions.question: What does 'DOM' stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: DOM stands for Document Object Model, which represents the structure of a web document.

questions.question: Which property is used in CSS to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: In CSS, the 'color' property is used to specify the text color of an element.

questions.question: Which method is used to add an element at the end of an array in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The push() method adds a new element to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid way to center a block element horizontally using CSS?
questions.explanation: Setting 'margin: 0 auto;' on a block element centers it horizontally within its container.
